article: In a world where comparisons happen non-stop, it is difficult to look outside yourself and to ever be _ with who you are. There's always someone who's a bit _ . The only solution is to reach _ and measure against what Warren Buffett calls your own inner yardstick. There is no more _ measure for comparison than who your were yesterday, last week or last decade, when you were at your _ . Nothing useful ever comes from comparison to others. Either you see yourself as better than someone and you get _ , or you see someone else as better than you and you feel like all your hard work is for _ . It is a fool's game. Not one of us is exactly _ . The only direct and honest comparison is _ yourself. Everything else is apples to oranges. My opinion is that you are only _ to compare yourself to someone else if their life _ is the same as your own. Good luck finding that _ . And one thing is for sure. No matter how hard you work and how dedicated you are, there will always be someone who can run a little faster, jump a little higher, score a little better or look a little nicer in a swimsuit. And if there's not, you can _ someone is coming up fast _ you. So how can you always win in life? Become your best _ . Having an image of your most recent past limits is the perfect thing to _ you to the next level. If you ran 7 flights of stairs yesterday, then do 8 today. Who _ if the guy next to you did 15? It doesn't make a bit of _ . You are a more _ person today than you were yesterday. Your own _ is all you need.
